sari9: 5 cups of water or chicken broth
sariTarif1: Wash and drain the yellow lentils.
sariTarif2: In a pot, heat the oil or butter and sauté the chopped onions until golden.
sariTarif3: Add the chopped carrots and potatoes, sauté for a few minutes.
sariTarif4: Add the washed yellow lentils to the pot and stir.
sariTarif5: Add salt, black pepper, and cumin, then pour in the water or chicken broth. Stir and bring to a boil.
sariTarif6: Once boiling, reduce the heat and simmer for about 20-25 minutes until the vegetables are completely tender.
sariTarif7: Blend the soup until smooth using a blender or immersion blender. If the soup is too thick, you can add more water.
sariTarif8: Return the soup to the stove and bring it to a boil again. Check the taste and adjust seasoning if necessary.
sariTarif9: Serve hot with lemon slices. Enjoy!

nohutlu5: 3 cups of water or chicken broth
nohutluTarif1: Soak the rice in salted warm water for about 20-30 minutes. Then rinse and drain well.
nohutluTarif2: In a pot, add the butter and vegetable oil. Once the fats are melted, add the rice and sauté until the rice becomes translucent.
nohutluTarif3: Add the cooked chickpeas and stir.
nohutluTarif4: Add salt and black pepper, then pour in the water or chicken broth. Stir and bring to a boil.
nohutluTarif5: Once boiling, cover the pot and simmer on low heat until the rice has absorbed all the liquid.
nohutluTarif6: After the rice is cooked, remove from heat and let it sit, covered, for about 10-15 minutes to steam.
nohutluTarif7: Fluff the rice and serve. Enjoy your meal!
bademli5: 3 cups of water or chicken broth
bademliTarif1: Soak the rice in salted warm water for about 20-30 minutes. Then rinse and drain.
bademliTarif2: To easily peel the almonds, soak them in boiling water for a few minutes, then transfer to cold water and peel off the skins.
bademliTarif3: In a pot, add the butter and vegetable oil. Once the fats are melted, add the almonds and lightly toast them. (If using onion, add it with the almonds and sauté until the onion is golden.)
bademliTarif4: Add the rice and cook until the rice becomes translucent.
bademliTarif5: Add the salt and black pepper, then pour in the water or chicken broth. Stir and bring to a boil.
bademliTarif6: Once boiling, cover the pot and reduce the heat. Cook until the rice absorbs all the liquid.
bademliTarif7: After the pilaf is cooked, remove from heat and let it sit, covered, for about 10-15 minutes to steam.
bademliTarif8: Fluff the pilaf before serving. Enjoy your meal!

etli10: 4 cups of water or beef broth
etliTarif1: Place the diced beef in a pot and cook until it releases and absorbs its own juices. Then add olive oil and cook until the meat is browned.
etliTarif2: Add the finely chopped onion and garlic and sauté until the onions are translucent.
etliTarif3: Add the tomato paste and cook until the raw smell disappears. Then add the grated tomatoes and cook, stirring occasionally.
etliTarif4: Add salt and black pepper. Stir in the bulgur and cook for a few minutes.
etliTarif5: Add water or beef broth and mix. Cover the pot and cook on low heat until the bulgur is tender.
etliTarif6: Once the pilaf is cooked, remove from heat and stir in the finely chopped parsley.
etliTarif7: Serve the meat bulgur pilaf hot. Enjoy your meal!
